title: Mazes of Menace
data:
The **Mazes of Menace** is the collective name for all the levels in the game. They can contain up to 81 levels, but not all will be present in every game.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Map](#Map)

- [2 Properties](#Properties)

- [3 Interdependence](#Interdependence)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
    - [4.1.1 Map](#Map_2)
  - [4.2 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
    - [4.2.1 Map](#Map_3)
  - [4.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
    - [4.3.1 Map](#Map_4)

## Map

This diagram shows which [dungeon levels](/wiki/Dungeon_level "Dungeon level") the various [special levels](/wiki/Special_level "Special level") and [branches](/wiki/Branch "Branch") can appear on. A branch is signified with a `--`. The Dungeons of Doom and Gehennom are technically branches, but appear contiguously as the main branch of the game.

Also note that, although they are not special levels *per se*, any levels between [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa") and The [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle") have a 4/5 probability of being [Mazes](/wiki/Maze "Maze").

|                                                               | [Oracle](/wiki/Oracle_\(level\) "Oracle (level)")                                | 5-9                                                  | **Yes**                                | **Yes**                                          | **Yes**                                              | **Yes**                                                 | **Yes**                                    | **Yes**                            |

| [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest")                                  | Filler levels                                                                    | 12-20                                                | **Yes**                                | **Yes**                                          | **Yes**                                              | **Yes**                                                 | **Yes**                                    | **Yes**                            |

|                                                               | [Wizard's Tower](/wiki/Wizard%27s_Tower "Wizard's Tower") (middle level)         | 37-46                                                | **Yes**                                | **Yes**                                          | No                                                   | **Yes**                                                 | No                                         | Only in maze section               |
|                                                               | [Fake Wizard's Tower](/wiki/Fake_Wizard%27s_Tower "Fake Wizard's Tower")         | 40-51                                                | Non-portal level only                  | **Yes**                                          | **Yes**[\[note 7\]](#cite_note-7)                    | **Yes**                                                 | **Yes**                                    | **Yes**                            |
|                                                               | [Vibrating square](/wiki/Vibrating_square "Vibrating square")                    | 44-52                                                | No                                     | **Yes**                                          | **Yes**                                              | **Yes**                                                 | No                                         | **Yes**                            |
|                                                               | [Moloch's Sanctum](/wiki/Moloch%27s_Sanctum "Moloch's Sanctum")                  | 45-53                                                | No                                     | No                                               | No                                                   | **Yes** [\[note 8\]](#cite_note-8)                      | No                                         | No                                 |
| [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower")           | (Vlad tower levels)                                                              | 31-41                                                | Middle level only                      | **Yes**                                          | No                                                   | **Yes**                                                 | No                                         | No                                 |

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) Diggable only on unimportant wall sections
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) The Catacombs variant is unmappable; the other variants are mappable.
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) The Catacombs variant has diggable walls except for some undiggable areas; the wine cellar variant only has a diggable area in the upper right; the mimic variant is undiggable.
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) **Yes** for everyone except [rogues](/wiki/Rogue_quest "Rogue quest")
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) **Yes** for [rogues](/wiki/Rogue_quest "Rogue quest") and [monks](/wiki/Monk_quest "Monk quest"); no for everyone else
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) **Yes** for everyone except [rogues](/wiki/Rogue_quest "Rogue quest") and [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai_quest "Samurai quest")
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) Cannot teleport into the tower.
8. [↑](#cite_ref-8) Only accessible after [invocation](/wiki/Invocation_ritual "Invocation ritual")

## Interdependence

Whenever there are several possibilities for the length of a branch, the depth of a branch entrance, or a special level, they are

- measured from the top of the parent branch,
- are equally likely,
- are independent of all the other choices made in this graph.

Exceptions are:

- [Mines' End](/wiki/Mines%27_End "Mines' End") is the lowest mines level.
- [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") always branches off just below the Oracle.
- The [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") portal is always 6-7 levels below the Oracle.
- The depth of [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios") is complicated, see its article.
- [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island") is 1-4 levels above the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle").
- The [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle") is the deepest level in the Dungeons of Doom.
- The [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead") is the topmost level of Gehennom and is always the level directly below the Castle.
- The [demon lord](/wiki/Demon_lord "Demon lord") levels ([Asmodeus' Lair](/wiki/Asmodeus%27_Lair "Asmodeus' Lair"), [Baalzebub's Lair](/wiki/Baalzebub%27s_Lair "Baalzebub's Lair"), [Juiblex's Swamp](/wiki/Juiblex%27s_Swamp "Juiblex's Swamp") and [Orcus-town](/wiki/Orcus-town "Orcus-town")) are always in Gehennom and therefore lower than the Valley.
- The [Vibrating Square](/wiki/Vibrating_Square "Vibrating Square") is the deepest accessible level of Gehennom. [Moloch's Sanctum](/wiki/Moloch%27s_Sanctum "Moloch's Sanctum") is immediately below, and both fake towers are 1-4 levels above.

Each level can be special in at most one way, and (additionally) host at most one branch entrance. For example, this means the stairs to [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower") can be located on any special level except [Juiblex](/wiki/Juiblex "Juiblex")' swamp and both [Fake Wizard's Towers](/wiki/Fake_Wizard%27s_Tower "Fake Wizard's Tower").

## Variants

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") adds to the dungeon with new [dungeon branches](/wiki/Dungeon_branch "Dungeon branch") as well amid some other minor tweaks. As of the 5.1.0 release these include the Nymph Level, the [Ruins of Moria](/wiki/Ruins_of_Moria "Ruins of Moria"), an improved [black market](/wiki/Black_market_\(UnNetHack\) "Black market (UnNetHack)"), the [Town](/wiki/Town "Town") branch, the [Dragon Caves](/wiki/Dragon_Caves "Dragon Caves"), and the Icy [Sheol](/wiki/Sheol "Sheol").

#### Map

### SLASH'EM

The layout of the Mazes of Menace differs significantly in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") due to an expanded [Dungeons of Doom](/wiki/Dungeons_of_Doom "Dungeons of Doom"), a shortened [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), and many new [dungeon branches](/wiki/Dungeon_branch "Dungeon branch").

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Mazes of Menace

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The Mazes of Menace is the collective name for all the levels in the game. They can contain up to 81 levels, but not all will be present in every game.

Contents

  • 1 Map
  • 2 Properties
  • 3 Interdependence
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 UnNetHack
      • 4.1.1 Map
    • 4.2 SLASH'EM
      • 4.2.1 Map
    • 4.3 dNetHack
      • 4.3.1 Map

Map

This diagram shows which dungeon levels the various special levels and branches can appear on. A branch is signified with a --. The Dungeons of Doom and Gehennom are technically branches, but appear contiguously as the main branch of the game.

Also note that, although they are not special levels per se, any levels between Medusa and The Castle have a 4/5 probability of being Mazes. 

|-5   |Astral
|-4   |Water
|-3   |Fire
|-2   |Air
|-1   |Earth
| 1 --/                               \
| 2 \                                 |--Dungeons of Doom
| 3 |------------------|Gnomish Mines |
| 4 /                  |              |
| 5 \           |soko4 | \Minetown    |
| 6 |Oracle  \  |soko3 | /            | 
| 7 |        |  |soko2 |              |
| 8 |        |--|soko1 |              |
| 9 /        |         |              |
|10          /  \      | \Mines' End  |
|11 \         \ |BigRm | /            |
|12 |--Ludios | /                     |

Properties

The following table lists the properties of the levels.

Branch Level Dungeon level Bones eligible? Mappable? Teleportable? Levelportable? Diggable floor? Diggable walls?
End Game Astral Plane -5 No No No No No No
Plane of Water -4 No Yes No No No Yes
Plane of Fire -3 No Yes No No No Yes
Plane of Air -2 No Yes No No No Yes
Plane of Earth -1 No Yes No No No Yes
Dungeons of Doom (Ordinary level) 1-28 Yes (except 1-3) Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes
Oracle 5-9 Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes
Big Room 10-12 Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes No
Rogue 15-18 Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes
Medusa's Island 21-28 No Yes No Yes Yes varies[note 1]
Castle 25-29 No Yes No Yes No Only in maze section
Gnomish Mines (Ordinary level) 3-12 Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes
Minetown 5-8 Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes
Mines' End 10-13 No varies[note 2] Yes Yes No varies[note 3]
Sokoban (Sokoban levels) 2-9 No Pre-mapped No No Yes No
Quest Filler levels 12-20 Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes
Home level 11-16 No varies[note 4] No Yes No No
Locate level 13-18 Yes Yes Yes Yes varies[note 5]
Goal level 15-21 No Yes varies[note 6] Yes No
Fort Ludios 11-27 No Yes No No No No
Gehennom (Ordinary level) 27-51 Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes
Valley of the Dead 26-30 Yes No No Yes No No
Asmodeus' Lair 27-36 Yes Yes No Yes Yes Not in Asmodeus' chamber
Juiblex's swamp 29-36 Yes Yes No Yes Yes Yes
Baalzebub's Lair 31-38 Yes Yes No Yes Yes Not in Baalzebub's chamber
Orcus-town 35-44 Yes Yes No Yes Yes Yes
Wizard's Tower (top and bottom level) 36-47 No Yes No Yes No Outside and small center only
Wizard's Tower (middle level) 37-46 Yes Yes No Yes No Only in maze section
Fake Wizard's Tower 40-51 Non-portal level only Yes Yes[note 7] Yes Yes Yes
Vibrating square 44-52 No Yes Yes Yes No Yes
Moloch's Sanctum 45-53 No No No Yes [note 8] No No
Vlad's Tower (Vlad tower levels) 31-41 Middle level only Yes No Yes No No
  1. ↑ Diggable only on unimportant wall sections
  2. ↑ The Catacombs variant is unmappable; the other variants are mappable.
  3. ↑ The Catacombs variant has diggable walls except for some undiggable areas; the wine cellar variant only has a diggable area in the upper right; the mimic variant is undiggable.
  4. ↑ Yes for everyone except rogues
  5. ↑ Yes for rogues and monks; no for everyone else
  6. ↑ Yes for everyone except rogues and Samurai
  7. ↑ Cannot teleport into the tower.
  8. ↑ Only accessible after invocation

Interdependence

Whenever there are several possibilities for the length of a branch, the depth of a branch entrance, or a special level, they are

  • measured from the top of the parent branch,
  • are equally likely,
  • are independent of all the other choices made in this graph.

Exceptions are:

  • Mines' End is the lowest mines level.
  • Sokoban always branches off just below the Oracle.
  • The quest portal is always 6-7 levels below the Oracle.
  • The depth of Fort Ludios is complicated, see its article.
  • Medusa's Island is 1-4 levels above the Castle.
  • The Castle is the deepest level in the Dungeons of Doom.
  • The Valley of the Dead is the topmost level of Gehennom and is always the level directly below the Castle.
  • The demon lord levels (Asmodeus' Lair, Baalzebub's Lair, Juiblex's Swamp and Orcus-town) are always in Gehennom and therefore lower than the Valley.
  • The Vibrating Square is the deepest accessible level of Gehennom. Moloch's Sanctum is immediately below, and both fake towers are 1-4 levels above.

Each level can be special in at most one way, and (additionally) host at most one branch entrance. For example, this means the stairs to Vlad's Tower can be located on any special level except Juiblex' swamp and both Fake Wizard's Towers.

Variants

UnNetHack

UnNetHack adds to the dungeon with new dungeon branches as well amid some other minor tweaks. As of the 5.1.0 release these include the Nymph Level, the Ruins of Moria, an improved black market, the Town branch, the Dragon Caves, and the Icy Sheol.

SLASH'EM

The layout of the Mazes of Menace differs significantly in SLASH'EM due to an expanded Dungeons of Doom, a shortened Gehennom, and many new dungeon branches.

rawPage:
The '''Mazes of Menace''' is the collective name for all the levels in the game. They can contain up to 81 levels, but not all will be present in every game. ==Map== This diagram shows which [[dungeon level]]s the various [[special level]]s and [[branch]]es can appear on. A branch is signified with a --. The Dungeons of Doom and Gehennom are technically branches, but appear contiguously as the main branch of the game. Also note that, although they are not special levels ''per se'', any levels between [[Medusa]] and The [[Castle]] have a 4/5 probability of being [[Maze]]s. |-5 |[[Astral Plane|Astral]] |-4 |[[Plane of Water|Water]] |-3 |[[Plane of Fire|Fire]] |-2 |[[Plane of Air|Air]] |-1 |[[Plane of Earth|Earth]] | 1 --/ \ | 2 \ |--[[Dungeons of Doom]] | 3 |------------------|[[Gnomish Mines]] | | 4 / | | | 5 \ |soko4 | \[[Minetown]] | | 6 |[[Oracle (level)|Oracle]] \ |soko3 | / | | 7 | | |soko2 | | | 8 | |--|[[Sokoban|soko1]] | | | 9 / | | | |10 / \ | \[[Mines' End]] | |11 \ \ |[[Big Room|BigRm]] | / | |12 |--[[Fort Ludios|Ludios]] | / | |13 | | | |14 | |--|[[Quest]] home | |15 | \ | | | |16 | |[[Rogue level|Rogue]] / |Quest locate | |17 | | | | |18 | / | \Quest goal | |19 | | / | |20 | | |21 | \ | |22 | |[[Medusa's Island|Medusa]] | |23 | | | |24 | | | |25 | | \ | |26 | | |[[Castle]] \ | \ |27 / | | |[[Valley of the Dead|Valley]] \ | |--[[Gehennom]] |28 / | | |[[Asmodeus' Lair|Asmodeus]] | | |29 / | \ | / | |30 / |[[Juiblex's swamp|Juiblex]] | | |31 | | \ | |32 | | |[[Baalzebub's Lair|Baalzebub]] | |33 |Vlad3 | | | | |34 \ |Vlad2 | | | | |35 |--|[[Vlad's Tower|Vlad1]] | \ | | | |36 | / |[[Orcus-town|Orcus]] / | \ | |37 | | | |[[Wizard's Tower|WizTower]] | |38 | | / | | |39 | | | | |40 | \ | | | |41 | |[[Fake Wizard's Tower|FakeWiz]] | | | |42 / | | | | |43 | | | | |44 | \ / | | |45 | |[[Vibrating square|VibSq]] \ | | |46 | | |[[Moloch's Sanctum|Sanctum]] | | |47 | | | / | |48 | | | | |49 | | | | |50 | | | | |51 / | | | |52 / | | |53 / / ==Properties== The following table lists the properties of the levels. {| class="wikitable collapsible" style="font-size: 95%; no for everyone else || |- |Goal level || 15-21 || No || '''Yes''' || ''varies'''''Yes''' for everyone except [[Rogue quest|rogues]] and [[Samurai quest|Samurai]] || '''Yes''' || No || |- |[[Fort Ludios]] || || 11-27 || No || '''Yes''' || No || No || No || No |- |rowspan=11|[[Gehennom]] || (Ordinary level) || 27-51 || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' |- |[[Valley of the Dead]] || 26-30 || '''Yes''' || No || No || '''Yes''' || No || No |- |[[Asmodeus' Lair]] || 27-36 || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || No || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || Not in Asmodeus' chamber |- |[[Juiblex's swamp]] || 29-36 || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || No || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' |- |[[Baalzebub's Lair]] || 31-38 || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || No || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || Not in Baalzebub's chamber |- |[[Orcus-town]] || 35-44 || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || No || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' |- |[[Wizard's Tower]] (top and bottom level) || 36-47 || No || '''Yes''' || No || '''Yes''' || No || Outside and small center only |- |[[Wizard's Tower]] (middle level) || 37-46 || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || No || '''Yes''' || No || Only in maze section |- |[[Fake Wizard's Tower]] || 40-51 || Non-portal level only || '''Yes''' || '''Yes'''Cannot teleport into the tower. || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' |- |[[Vibrating square]] || 44-52 || No || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || '''Yes''' || No || '''Yes''' |- |[[Moloch's Sanctum]] || 45-53 || No || No || No || '''Yes''' Only accessible after [[Invocation ritual|invocation]] || No || No |- |[[Vlad's Tower]] || (Vlad tower levels) || 31-41 || Middle level only || '''Yes''' || No || '''Yes''' || No || No |} ==Interdependence== Whenever there are several possibilities for the length of a branch, the depth of a branch entrance, or a special level, they are * measured from the top of the parent branch, * are equally likely, * are independent of all the other choices made in this graph. Exceptions are: * [[Mines' End]] is the lowest mines level. * [[Sokoban]] always branches off just below the Oracle. * The [[quest]] portal is always 6-7 levels below the Oracle. * The depth of [[Fort Ludios]] is complicated, see its article. * [[Medusa's Island]] is 1-4 levels above the [[Castle]]. * The [[Castle]] is the deepest level in the Dungeons of Doom. * The [[Valley of the Dead]] is the topmost level of Gehennom and is always the level directly below the Castle. * The [[demon lord]] levels ([[Asmodeus' Lair]], [[Baalzebub's Lair]], [[Juiblex's Swamp]] and [[Orcus-town]]) are always in Gehennom and therefore lower than the Valley. * The [[Vibrating Square]] is the deepest accessible level of Gehennom. [[Moloch's Sanctum]] is immediately below, and both fake towers are 1-4 levels above. Each level can be special in at most one way, and (additionally) host at most one branch entrance. For example, this means the stairs to [[Vlad's Tower]] can be located on any special level except [[Juiblex]]' swamp and both [[Fake Wizard's Tower]]s. ==Variants== ===UnNetHack=== [[UnNetHack]] adds to the dungeon with new [[dungeon branch]]es as well amid some other minor tweaks. As of the 5.1.0 release these include the Nymph Level, the [[Ruins of Moria]], an improved [[Black market (UnNetHack)|black market]], the [[Town]] branch, the [[Dragon Caves]], and the Icy [[Sheol]].
